channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Setts loose in road, 11th June
item.description:
Following works by Thames Water to connect 1-4 Chapel Side the setts in the road are not mortared in and working loose, particularly with daily lorry deliveries to the building site. The setts around the Openreach manhole outside 30-33 Chapel Side are also relaid very unevenly creating a greater than usual trip hazard following the road butchers employed by Openreach.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Chapel Side, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation is blocking the pavement, 11th June
item.description:
At two points in Glenhurst Avenue is impeding the pavement. Outside nos 41/43 growth from the garden is blocking the oavement. Outside no 59 the main problem is growth from a street tree (as shown in photo) but also the garden hedge is soreading out across the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Glenhurst Avenue, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees, 11th June
item.description:
The tree outside my mum’s house needs cutting back as some branches are hanging extremely low. My mum is 72 years old and has mobility issues (walks with a stick). She finds it extremely difficult to walk past her house, as she has to duck down low to pass under the branches. It is even worse when it has been raining. The branches are also hanging over into her front garden. I am worried she will lose her balance and fall over. She has contacted the royal borough of Greenwich, but has had no response. It’s only the bottom few branches that need cutting back, not the whole tree. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bastion Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
